content:
[Section: Experience]
Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Organization: Trainline
Location: London, United Kingdom
Dates: June 2024 - Present
Content: Co-led research, development, and deployment of a real-time personalisation agent using Contextual Bandits and Reinforcement Learning (RL), increasing conversion and revenue through bespoke content delivery and customised product recommendations throughout the customer purchasing journey.

[Section: Experience]
Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Organization: Trainline
Location: London, United Kingdom
Dates: June 2024 - Present
Content: Built end-to-end CLTV prediction pipelines based on adapted research models, enhancing a marketing campaign for early customer churn prevention and driving a statistically significant uplift in customer retention.

[Section: Experience]
Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Organization: Trainline
Location: London, United Kingdom
Dates: June 2024 - Present
Content: Led a Trainline Hackathon initiative, ideating and prototyping a RAG-based LLM assistant leveraging Databricks LLM, LangChain, and Gradio, streamlining onboarding for incoming ML Engineers.

[Section: Experience]
Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Organization: Trainline
Location: London, United Kingdom
Dates: June 2024 - Present
Content: Ensured reliability of production ML pipelines by resolving failures across AWS EMR, MLFlow, and Jenkins, leveraging Airflow and New Relic for monitoring and orchestration.

[Section: Experience]
Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Organization: Trainline
Location: London, United Kingdom
Dates: June 2024 - Present
Content: Deployed 3 PoCs on Databricks and delivered technical assessments and presentations, driving workflow efficiency improvements and influencing tooling strategy across the Data team.

[Section: Experience]
Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Consultant)
Organization: Guidehouse
Location: London, United Kingdom
Dates: Aug 2023 - May 2024
Content: Developed deep autoencoders and time-series models for gas pressure anomaly detection, enabling early identification of methane leaks across a national gas distribution network.

[Section: Experience]
Title: AI Research Assistant
Organization: University of Hong Kong - Dept of Medicine
Location: Hong Kong, Hong Kong SAR
Dates: Aug 2021 - May 2022
Content: Fine-tuned ResNet-18 on proprietary clinical imaging data to automate fracture classification, contributing to a production-ready medical imaging model.

[Section: Skills]
Content: Programming: Python, PySpark, SQL, OOP, R, Matlab

[Section: Skills]
Content: AI/ML Frameworks: PyTorch, HuggingFace, Scikit-Learn, CatBoost, XGBoost, Vowpal Wabbit

[Section: Skills]
Content: LLM Stack: Multimodal LLM, Fine-tuning, LoRA, RAG, LangChain, DataParallel

[Section: Skills]
Content: Data Platforms: Databricks, AWS Athena, AWS EMR, AWS S3, Starburst Galaxy

[Section: Skills]
Content: DevOps/MLOps: MLFlow, Airflow, Git, Docker, Jenkins, New Relic, Pex, Make, AWS ECS

[Section: Skills]
Content: Python Libraries: Pytest, Pydantic, NumPy, SciPy, Statsmodels, Pandas, Matplotlib, SHAP, Seaborn

[Section: Projects]
Content: Developed GIT-ARRG-X, a vision-language model using Generative Image Transformers (GIT) for chest X-ray report generation, as part of the X-Raydar Project, an NHS-backed initiative led by Prof. Giovanni Montana, improving the clinical quality and coherence of AI-generated medical reports.

[Section: Education]
Content: MSc Statistics, University of Warwick (2022 - 2023): Distinction, Winton Dissertation Prize Winner. Dissertation: 'Automatic Radiological Report Generation of Chest Radiographs using Deep Learning'

[Section: Education]
Content: BSc Mathematics (Honours), The Chinese University of Hong Kong (2016 - 2020): Enrichment Mathematics Scholarship Recipient - Top 30 students in Hong Kong admitted to the programme.

[Section: Contact]
Content: Name: Tony C.H. Kwok
